00027 #ifndef WIN32
00028 #include <netinet/in.h>
00029 #endif
00030 
00031 
00032   #undef uuid_t
00033   typedef struct _uuid_t {
00034       unsigned32          time_low;
00035       unsigned16          time_mid;
00036       unsigned16          time_hi_and_version;
00037       unsigned8           clock_seq_hi_and_reserved;
00038       unsigned8           clock_seq_low;
00039       byte                node[6];
00040   } uuid_t;
00041 
00042   /* uuid_create -- generate a UUID */
00043   int uuid_create(uuid_t * uuid);
00044 
00045   /* uuid_create_from_name -- create a UUID using a "name"
00046      from a "name space" */
00047   void uuid_create_from_name(
00048     uuid_t * uuid,        /* resulting UUID */
00049     uuid_t nsid,          /* UUID to serve as context, so identical
00050                              names from different name spaces generate
00051                              different UUIDs */
00052     void * name,          /* the name from which to generate a UUID */
00053     int namelen           /* the length of the name */
00054   );
00055 
00056   /* uuid_compare --  Compare two UUID's "lexically" and return
00057           -1   u1 is lexically before u2
00058            0   u1 is equal to u2
00059            1   u1 is lexically after u2
00060      Note:   lexical ordering is not temporal ordering!
00061   */
00062   int uuid_compare(uuid_t *u1, uuid_t *u2);
